1: Atabo and Akiru went to the river to collect water.
2: On their way back home they rested on some rocks.
3:
Atabo tried to stand up to continue home. But she was stuck to the rock.
Akiru ran home to call mother.
4: When mother arrived at the rock, she found Atabo truly stuck.
5: "I will make a fence around the rock to protect you from wild animals," mother said to Atabo.
6: So, she made a fence. And she made one door for her to get inside.
7:
Then mother said to Atabo, "I will bring you food. When I come I will sing a song for you to open the door."
This is what she sang, "lka kook nachirima. Bala ekena, ke...ke...i...ya.Tangarae totokonia kainak ngakon kile."
Mother also said, "Never open the door to a stranger." Whenever she came she sang the song. Atabo would open the door and receive the food.
8: Hyena was hiding and listening. He watched when mother came to feed Atabo.
9: Hyena tried to copy mother's song. He practised and practised.
10:
The other animals told Hyena to swallow a fly from the river so that he could sing better.
He swallowed a fly from the river and went to sing. But the door did not open.
11:
Next, he swallowed a fly from the nearby plains and he went to sing. But the door did not open.
Finally he swallowed a fly from the far away plains.
12:
With this new voice he again went to sing at the door.
The door opened, and Hyena ate Atabo.
13:
When mother came again, she sang, and sang, and sang. But nothing happened.
So she called a meeting of all the animals and lit a large fire. "The animal that ate Atabo will fall into the fire and burn," she said.
14: All the animals jumped safely over the fire. Only Fox and Hyena remained.
15:
Fox jumped and the fire caught his tail. He cried in pain.
Last of all came the hyena. He jumped and fell into the fire.
16: Then all the animals sang, "Ata kalio. Anikanyamit ikon koku. Achakakin nakim na, chi...gi...gir."
